name: Networked Learning Community
content: Generally, there are 2 segments in a NLC meeting in the Primary Math Chapter.  In the first segment, either a Master Teacher or a teacher leader will lead in learning a new strategy / approach in teaching math.  To strengthen the theory-practice nexus, learning is always underpinned by a theory or learning principle.  Sometimes, it could be a talk by a NIE lecturer or math educator.   In the second segment of ther meeting, members will share their classroom practice or raise issues for discussion on a certain topic or invite inputs for work-in-progress.  View the video below which is an episode of a professional conversation in a Primary Math LT-ST Network.

How does learning in a NLC look like?  View the video above as 4 teachers talked about their learning in a Differentiated Instruction in Primary Math NLC.  Led by Lead Teacher Agnes, the other 3 STs (Karen, Chor Lan and Nashita) are now co-leaders of this NLC which reaches out to about 15 teachers who are interested to use DI in their Math lessons.

What are your thoughts about networked learning?  Do you have a question to ask?  Click on 'Post Reply'...
